document_data.name: An Old Warrior's Way
document_data.author: [[Dathlance]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''An Old Warrior's Way''''' was [[book]] penned by [[Dathlance]] of [[Selgaunt]] in the late 13{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''The [[bard]]s soon forget a [[warrior]] falling without a great feat of arms. Would you be forgotten? Face each battle, each foe, as though it is your last. One day it will be.''|Excerpt from ''An Old Warrior's Way''}}
document_data.History: ''An Old Warrior's Way'' was a tome that collected musings and life lessons of a warrior from [[Sembia]], Dathlance. It was published in the {{YearlinkName|1275}}.{{Cite web/The Candlekeep Collection}} Another copy was kept in the War Library of the [[Abbey of the Sword]] in [[Battledale]] as of the late 14{{th}} century DR.
